page.title: 06NILL FARM
page.content: NILL FARM IS OWNED BY MR. IRVINE. THERE ARE 7 IN THE FAMILY AND THEY HAVE LIVED THERE FOR 11 YEARS ALTHOUGH THE FARM HAS BEEN THERE FOR 250 YEARS. THEY HAVE 140 MILKING COWS, 6 PONIES WHICH THEY HUNT, AND FARM 340 ACRES OF LAND. THEY HAVE IMPROVED THE FARM BY ADDING MODERN MILKING PARLOURS,TENNIS COURT AND THE SWIMMING POOL. THE FARM BELONGED TO THE LOCAL CHURCH AT ONE TIME AND THEY USED IT TO REAR PIGS. THE NAME 'NILL' MEANS 'AN OLD CLUMP OF TREES' BUT IT IS NOT KNOWN WHICH TREES EXACTLY. THE DOVECOTE WAS MENTIONED IN THE DOMESDAY BOOK. MR. IRVINE IS WORRIED ABOUT ALL THE FERTILISERS WHICH MANY FARMERS USE TO REAR THEIR CORN AND HE HAS STOPPED GROWING IT AS IT WAS KILLING THE WILD LIFE ON HIS FARM. THE HIGHLIGHT OF THE VISIT WAS BEING INVITED TO SWIM IN THEIR OUTDOOR POOL.
